problem_text:
A famous result of Burnside states that if k(G) is the number of conjugacy classes of a finite group G of odd order, then |G| − k(G) is divisible by 16. Is it true that for every integer m > 0 there exists a finite non-abelian group G(m) of odd order such that |G(m)| − k(G(m)) = 16m?
D. MacHale
